alert.note: Alert for Nemaha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:10PM CDT until April 15 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR JOHNSON...WESTERN NEMAHA...WESTERN OTOE AND PAWNEE COUNTIES... At 709 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Cook to 2 miles north of Tecumseh to 5 miles west of Pawnee City, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 707 PM, quarter sized hail was reported 6 miles south of Burchard. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Cook around 720 PM CDT. Syracuse, Unadilla and Table Rock around 725 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Elk Creek, Lorton, Tecumseh, Dunbar, Johnson, Talmage and Brock. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
